Falcidian Portion.definition: the one-fourth portion of a succession that may be retained by the instituted heir in civil law if more than three-fourths of the succession was bequeathed to other legatees compare legitime
Falcidian Portion.origin: [from Falcidius , Roman tribune who proposed the law passed in 40 B.C. that established the portion]

1.1: the one-fourth portion of a succession that may be retained by the instituted heir in civil law if more than three-fourths of the succession was bequeathed to other legatees compare
1.note: The Falcidian portion is expressly abolished in the Louisiana Civil Code.
